Material used.Description: N2A and CHO cells stably expressing WT and E163K DJ-1 were used to assess solubility.

Readout description.Result Description: The E163K mutant form of human DJ-1 showed no differences in solubility compared to WT DJ-1, being most abundant in soluble Triton X-100 fractions.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for comparison.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Similar solubility distribution as WT DJ-1 in Triton X-100 fractions.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant presence in SDS fractions indicating insolubility.

Material used.Description: N2A and CHO cells stably expressing WT and E163K DJ-1 were used to assess dimerization.

Readout description.Result Description: The E163K mutant DJ-1 eluted at the same fractions as WT DJ-1, corresponding to a molecular mass of ~42 kDa, indicating dimer formation.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for dimerization.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Elution at fractions corresponding to ~42 kDa, indicating dimer formation.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Elution at fractions corresponding to lower molecular mass, indicating failure to dimerize.

Material used.Description: N2A and CHO cells stably expressing WT and E163K DJ-1 were used to assess protein stability.

Readout description.Result Description: The E163K mutant DJ-1 showed similar turnover rates to WT DJ-1, indicating comparable stability.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for stability comparison.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Turnover rate similar to WT DJ-1 over 25 hours.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly faster turnover rate compared to WT DJ-1, indicating reduced stability.

Material used.Description: N2A cells stably expressing WT and E163K DJ-1 were used to assess subcellular localization.

Readout description.Result Description: The E163K mutant DJ-1 showed similar predominant cytoplasmic distribution as WT DJ-1 under normal conditions.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for localization comparison.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Predominant cytoplasmic distribution similar to WT DJ-1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation from cytoplasmic distribution, indicating altered localization.

Material used.Description: N2A cells stably expressing WT and E163K DJ-1 were used to assess protection against various stressors.

Readout description.Result Description: The E163K mutant DJ-1 failed to protect against oxidative stress (H2O2) and showed increased vulnerability, while it retained protective ability against mitochondrial and proteasomal stress.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple clones of N2A cells expressing E163K DJ-1 (clones #16, #47, #52) and WT DJ-1 (clones #11, #12) were tested.

Technical replicates.Description: Each cell type was treated in sextuplicates.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 expressing cells were used as a positive control for protection against stressors.

Basic negative control.Description: Native N2A cells without DJ-1 expression were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Standard deviation was calculated for error bars in viability results.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability similar to or greater than WT DJ-1 expressing cells under stress conditions.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cell viability significantly lower than WT DJ-1 expressing cells, indicating loss of protective function.

Material used.Description: N2A cells stably expressing WT and E163K DJ-1 were used to assess localization under oxidative stress.

Readout description.Result Description: Under oxidative stress, E163K mutant DJ-1 showed a 6-fold decrease in overlap with mitochondrial marker compared to a 5-fold increase for WT DJ-1.

Technical replicates.Description: Five images per sample were taken for quantification.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 expressing cells were used as a positive control for localization changes under stress.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Standard deviation was calculated for error bars in relative pixel intensity measurements.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Increased overlap with mitochondrial marker under oxidative stress, similar to WT DJ-1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Decreased overlap with mitochondrial marker under oxidative stress, indicating impaired redistribution.
